TEXT.TITLE: FRANCE PLANS TO COVER SOCIAL SECURITY DEFICIT
TEXT.BODY: French government ministers will meet next Tuesday to discuss measures to cover the state Social Security Fund's deficit before the summer, Prime Minister Jacques Chirac's social affairs adviser, Marie-Helene Berard, said. Employment Ministry officials say the fund, in surplus until 1985, faces a 24 billion franc deficit by the end of this year, largely because of rising unemployment. Budget Minister Alain Juppe said the fund needed more resources and a management overhaul. The government was not in favour of introducing an additional tax to fund the deficit as did the previous socialist administration between 1982 and 1985, he said. REUTER
